duck: Transvaal Province (1910–1994), province of the Union and Republic of South Africa
South African Republic or "Zuid-Afrikaansche Republiek" (1856–1877 and 1881–1902), sometimes called the Transvaal Republic in English
Inhabited by Bantu-speaking Black Africans, the area was settled by Boer farmers who formed an independent state, called the South African Republic, in the 1850s.

milestones: Cheetahs and Blue Bulls draw 28-28 in Currie Cup rugby final

wiki.text:
'Transvaal' is a geographic term associated with land north of (i.e., beyond)
the Vaal River in modern day South Africa. Many states and administrative
divisions have carried the name Transvaal.

* South African Republic or "Zuid-Afrikaansche Republiek" (1856–1877 and
  1881–1902), sometimes called the Transvaal Republic in English
* Transvaal Colony (1877–1881 and 1902–1910), British colony
* Transvaal Province (1910–1994), province of the Union and Republic of
  South Africa
wiki.title: transvaal
